snippet: The choreographer Pavel Zustiak’s “Strange Cargo,” the final part of his “Painted Bird” trilogy, is being performed through Sunday at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.
abstract: Gia Kourlas reviews premiere performance of Pavel Zustiak dance Strange Cargo, the final section of his Painted Bird trilogy, at Synod Hall. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Pavel Zustiak, born in what was then Czechoslovakia, has reason to focus on notions of identity and home. In a way his ''Painted Bird'' trilogy, which takes its point of departure from the Jerzy Kosinski 1965 novel of that title, reveals Mr. Zustiak's quest to find his place in the world -- mirroring the wandering young male protagonist in the book. Yet on unveiling the premiere of ''Strange Cargo,'' the third and final section, Mr. Zustiak shows that he still has some searching to do.
